holidays.name: National Video Games Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the world of video games and the joy they bring to players of all ages.
holidays.origin: Originating in the early 2000s as gaming became mainstream, this day honors the creativity and fun of video games.
holidays.funFact: The best-selling video game of all time, Minecraft, has sold over 200 million copies worldwide!

holidays.name: Chocolate Milkshake Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to enjoying the creamy, sweet treat of chocolate milkshakes!
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday created by aficionados of this classic dessert drink.
holidays.funFact: The first ice cream milkshake, similar to what we know today, dates back to the early 20th century and was originally an alcoholic eggnog!

holidays.name: National Pet Memorial Day
holidays.description: A day to honor and remember the beloved pets who have passed away and the joy they brought to our lives.
holidays.origin: Established in 2000 in the United States to give pet owners a chance to celebrate the lives of their furry friends.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that talking about deceased pets and holding memorials can help pet owners with the grieving process.

holidays.name: Defy Superstition Day
holidays.description: Encourages people to face their irrational fears and break free from superstitious beliefs, like walking under ladders or breaking mirrors.
holidays.origin: An unofficial quirky observance that gained traction via social media as a positive and humorous reminder to challenge unfounded fears.
holidays.funFact: Many common superstitions, such as Friday the 13th being unlucky, have no basis in reality but continue to influence behavior worldwide.
